UPON ARRIVAL AT J01 TRACK AROUND 1400 HRS, THE DAMAGED BUCK LOADER WAS FOUND BUT THE RAIL CAR THAT HAD STRUCK THE BUCK LOADER WAS NO LONGER IN J01. UPON FURTHER INVESTIGATION AOK 501886 WAS IDENTIFIED IN THE YARD WITH A PRIMARY CLASS CODE OF Q211 (TDSI) AND AN OPERATING CLASS CODE OF BOS. DAMAGE ON THE END DOOR OF AOK 501886 CORRESPONDED  TO THE DAMAGE ON THE BUCK LOADER. IT WAS DETERMINED THAT AOK 501886 HAD BEEN SHOVED OFF THE END OF J01 TRACK, STRUCK THE BUCK LOADER, WAS PULLED BACK UP ONTO THE TRACK, AND PLACED BACK INTO THE YARD.

THEY KICKED 2 LOADS AT6 MPH INTO TRACK N062 THAT ALREADY HAD 47 CARS IN THE TRACK, 44 OF THE CARS WERE COUPLED AT THE NORTH END AND 3 CARS WERE AT THE SOUTH END OF THE YARD. AFTER COUPLING, THE SLACK ACTION FORCED THE 46 CARS AT THE NORTH END OVER THE LIP OF .5% GRADE. THESE 46 CARS ROLLED DOWN THE GRADE FOR APPROX. 45 CAR LENGTHS AND THEN IMPACTED THE 3 CARS AT THE SOUTH END OF THE YARD, WHICH IN TURN STRUCK UNIT CN 8841 THAT WAS OPERATING ON THE SOUTH LEAD. SHPX 43036, GLVX 30 AND PTLX 34213 WERE DERAILED AT THE N062 SWITCH AND UNIT CN 8841 SUSTAINED DAMAGE. LOCAL SWITCHING RULE MANDATE THAT 9 HAND BRAKES MUST BEAPPLIED ON THIS PARTICULAR CAR CONSIST AND TRACK. THE TRACK WAS FOUND TO HAVE ONLY 6 HAND BRAKES APPLIED - CARS ROLLED OUT DUE TO INSUFFICIENT BRAKES APPLIED.

08242010-d-08-24-10-UTAX.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
08242010-d-08-24-10-UTAX.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
08242010-d-08-24-10-UTAX.Narrative: CONSTRUCTION SUBCONTRACTOR, MASS ELECTRIC PLACED LOADED TRACTOR/TRAILOR SEMI ONTO  THE TRACK TO DELIVER FEEDER CABLE TO A TRACTION POWER STATION UNDER CONSTRUCTION. AS THE SEMI'S RUBBER WHEELS WERE LIFTED FROM THE TRACK BY THE HI-RAIL STEEL WHEELS, THE SEMI ROLLED WITHOUT BRAKES DUE TO THE DOWNHILLGRADE AT THIS LOCATION. THE HI-RAIL SEMI IS DESIGNED TO USE THE SEMI'S RUBBER WHEELS AND BRAKE SYSTEMS TO PROVIDE BRAKING. AS THE HI-RAIL STEEL WHEELS LIFTED, THE SEMI'S RUBBER WHEELS LOST CONTACT WITH THE TRACK, AND AS A RESULT ROLLED, UNATTENDED APPROXIMATELY 2.8 MILES, JUMPING TWO DERAILS POSITIONED OPPOSITE THE HI-RAILS MOVEMENT, WITHOUT DERAILING. THE HI-RAIL SEMI COLLIDED WITH A SECOND UNOCCCUPIED HI-RAIL VEHICLE THAT WAS ON THE TRACK.  THE HI-RAIL STEEL WHEEL ASSEMPLY LACKS ANY FORM OF MECHANICAL, ELECTICAL, PNUEMATIC OR AIR SUPPLIED BRAKES SYSTEMS, RELYING SOLELY ON THE SEMI'S BRAKINGSYSTEM. THE HI-RAIL OPERATOR LACKED PROPER TRAINING AND UNDERSTANDING OF THE SEMI'S BRAKING SYSTEM.THE PORTABLE DERAILS WERE IMPROPERLY POSITIONED TO PROTECT THE AFFECTED WORK ZONES. THERE WERE NO INJURIES. THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO THE TRACK OR SIGNAL SYSTEMS.

679980-d-08-09-10-IC.Narrative: M33891-08 PULLED SOUTH ON #3 THOROFARE, STOPPED AND WAITED FOR POLL DOWN JOB TO CLEAR IN #4 THOROFARE. THE TRAIN THEN PULLED SOUTH MAKING A CUT ON 15 CARS THAT WERE LEFT IN #3 THOROFARE AND PULLED SOUTH AGAIN WITH 110 CARS TO SHOVE INTO F12 TO THE NORTH END. WHILE SHOVING NORTH, THE CONDUCTOR WAS RIDING THE POINT GIVING CAR COUNTS TO THE ENGINEER WHEN THE TRAIN WENT TO EMERGENCY. INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT CARS TBOX 665945, TB0X 660910, TBOX 670115 & MLLX 11159 DERAILED AT THE #4 THOROFARE FOG ACCOUNT TRAIN HANDLING. WHEN THE CARS DERAILED, THEY WENT INTO ITLX 44025 & GFSX 101444 WHICH WERE STANDING IN THE CUT OF CARS LEFT IN #3 THOROFARE CAUSING THESE CARS TO DERAIL ALSO. CREW WAS TESTED FORCAUSE, RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.

THE CREW HADSWITCHED 2 CARS INTO JN19 AND HAD A HOLD OF 6 CARS, PREPARING TO SWITCH ONE CAR INTO JN09 WHEN THECONDUCTOR LINED THE WRONG SWITCH FOR HIS MOVEMENT. THE CONDUCTOR LINED THE CROSSOVER SWITCH FROM THESWITCHING LEAD TO THE "RUN THRU" TRACK AND TOLD THE ENGINEER TO COME AHEAD 4 CARS TO SWITCH THE NEXT CAR TO NJ09. HE BEGAN WALKING NORTH TO LINE THE NJ09 SWITCH.  WHEN THE CONDUCTOR LOOKED BACK AT THIS MOMENT, HE SAW THAT THE SOUTH CARS OF HIS CUT WAS GOING INTO THE SIDE OF CARS THAT WERE ON THE "RUN THRU" TRACK AND STOPPED THE MOVEMENT. THEY SIDEWIPED CGTX 65138 WITH EQUX 631648. THE CAUSE OF THE INCIDENT HAS DETERMINED TO BE THE CONDUCTOR LINED THE INCORRECT SWITCH FOR THE MOVEMENT.

681222-d-08-21-10-IC.Narrative: R99471-20 WAS ATTEMPTING TO SPOT 24 LOADS OF SOYBEANS AT THE ADM PLAT. THE TRAIN PULLED NORTH BY THEMAINLINE SWITCH, STOPPED, LINED THE SWITCH TOWARDS THE INDUSTRY AND THEN WALKED TO THE DERAIL. THEDERAIL WAS UNLOCKED BUT NOT REMOVED WHEN THEY STARTED SHOVING TOWARDS THE INDUSTRY TRACK. THE CONDUCTOR CAUGHT ON AFTER SHOVING ABOUT 10 CARS LENGTHS TO RIDE THE DUMPER AND THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. THE BRAKEMAN STAYED AT THE TRACK 2/3 SWITCH TO MAKE THE CUT BEHIND THE LOCOMOTIVE, TURNED AND SAW THE CARS DERAILING AT THE TIME OF THE UNDESIRED EMERGENCY. INVESTIGATION SHOWED THAT THE DERAIL WAS NEVER REMOVED CAUSING THE DERAILMENT OF CC 3023, CC 481966, RRRX 182928, ATCX 47010, IC 799911 ANDRRRX 460235.  CAR RRRX 182928 WAS SCRAPPED.

20101-d-08-13-10-BSVY.Narrative: HAD TRACK DAMAGED BY FLOODS FROM 2 MONTHS OF HEAVY RAINS. TAKING A WORK TRAIN OF BALLAST AND RIPRAPTO REPAIR SITE, TRACK BED COLLAPSED, DERAILED 2 CARS AND 1 ENGINE. FLOOD WATERS ALONG RIGHT OF WAY PERMEATED ROAD BED CAUSING COLLAPSE.

681869-d-08-27-10-CC.Primary Accident Cause: Other track geometry defects (Provide detailed description in narrative)
681869-d-08-27-10-CC.Accident Cause: Other track geometry defects (Provide detailed description in narrative)
681869-d-08-27-10-CC.Narrative: L5789-27 SHOVED INTO THE PUBLIC STORAGE TRACK WITH TWO LOCOMOTIVE AND FIVE CARS IN ORDER TO PULL ONECAR (DWC 793961) FROM PUBLIC STORAGE. AFTER PICKING UP THIS CAR THE MOVEMENT REVERSED ITS MOVEMENTTO THE EAST, DOWN THE LEMARS INDUSTRIAL SPUR IN ORDER TO GO TO THE MAIN TRACK AND COUPLE BACK TO THEIR TRAIN. ONCE OUT ON THE LEMARS INDUSTRIAL SPUR THE MOVEMENT STARTED ACROSS THE 18TH STREET ROAD CROSSING WHEN THE LEAD WHEELS ON ARMN 765296, UNKNOWINGLY TO THE CREW, DERAILED AT THE LEADING EDGE OFTHE 18TH STREET CROSSING. MOVEMENT CONTINUED FOR APPROXIMATELY EIGHT CAR LENGTH BEYOND THE CROSSINGWHEN THE CONDUCTOR, WHO WAS RIDDING THE REAR CAR, NOTICED THAT SOMETHING DIDN'T LOOK RIGHT. BEFORETHE CONDUCTOR COULD GET THE MOVEMENT STOPPED THIS CAR HIT A FROG RESULTING IN ARMN 765296, ARMN 76411 DERAILING. THE 4TH CAR ALSO STRUCK ITGX 6485 IN THE ADJACENT TRACK CAUSING SAFETY APPLIANCE DAMAGETO THE ITGX CAR. THERE WAS ALSO APPROXIMATELY 30-50 GALLONS OF DIESEL FUEL THAT LEAKED FROM THE REFRIGERATED CAR ARMN 764215. THERE WERE NO INJURIES AND NO IMPACT TO MAIN TRACK MOVEMENT.

2010A070-d-08-09-10-IAIS.Narrative: EASTBOUND TRAIN WAS DERAILED BY A WASHOUT.  THE WATER WAS NOT OVER THE RAIL BUT IT UNDERCUT THE BALLAST FROM THE SHOULDER.

0810CB004-d-08-05-10-UP.Narrative: LNM34-05 WAS HEADED NORTHBOUND WITH 62 RAILCARS TRAVELING AT 7 MPH. THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY DUE TO SUB GRADE/BALLAST CONDITIONS DERAILING RAILCARS UTLX 85800, SAMX 60001, CRGX 30033, CRGX 30034,AND CRGX 30023.  RAIL = CWR

MAP0810102-d-08-10-10-IANR.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
MAP0810102-d-08-10-10-IANR.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement
MAP0810102-d-08-10-10-IANR.Narrative:
CREW WAS SHOVING 19 CARS INTO INDUSTRY TRACK #55 (THINKING THEY WERE SHOVING INTO TRACK #54). THE SHOVING MOVE WAS NOT BEING PROTECTED WITH A PERSON ON THE POINT OF SHOVE. AS THEY NEARED THE END OF THE TRACK WITH THE MOVEMENT A RAKING COLLISION OCCURRED WITH A CAR SITTING ON THE OPPOSITE LEAD. IT SHALL BE NOTED THAT AS THE MOVEMENT BEGAN, THE ENGINEER ASKED THE CONDUCTOR IF HE WAS OBSERVING THE MOVEMENT. PRIOR TO MAKING THE SHOVING MOVEMENT, THE CONDUCTOR HAD DRIVEN A VEHICLE TO THE OPPOSITE ENDOF TRACK #54 TO DETERMINE IF THERE WAS AMPLE ROOM TO MAKE THE SHOVE. HE DETERMINED THAT IN FACT THERE WAS SUFFICIENT ROOM. 
 (NEITHER OF THE CARS INVOLVED IN THE INCIDENT WERE DERAILED, HOWEVER BOTHSUSTAINED DAMAGE TO SAFETY APPLIANCES AND TO THE OUTER SHELLS OF CAR BODIES). 

THE CONDUCTOR BEGAN THE PLANNED SHOVING MOVEMENT THINKING HE WAS LINED INTO TRACK #54 HOWEVER HE WAS IN FACT LINED INTO TRACK #55. INSTEAD OF PROPERLY PROTECTING THE SHOVE, THE CONDUCTOR CHOSE TO STAND OFF TO THE SIDEOF THE MOVEMENT TO OBSERVE THE SHOVE, NOT NOTICING THAT HE WAS SHOVING INTO THE WRONG TRACK. AS THEMOVEMENT PROGRESSED HE EVENTUALLY LOST SITE OF THE LEADING CAR.

STD0804101-d-08-04-10-IANR.Primary Accident Cause: Use of brakes, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
STD0804101-d-08-04-10-IANR.Accident Cause: Use of brakes, other (Provide detailed description in narrative)
STD0804101-d-08-04-10-IANR.Narrative: THE IANR CREW’S INSTRUCTIONS WERE TO PULL 72 LOADS OFF OF THE TRACK. THE CREW TRAVELLED THE MAIN TRACK TO PLACE AN EOT ONTO THE REAR NORTHERN MOST CAR. AS THE EOT WAS PLACED THE CREW OBSERVED THAT THEREAR CAR WAS APPROXIMATELY 30 FEET FROM THE DERAIL. THE CONDUCTOR VERIFIED THAT THE REAR CAR HAD AHAND BRAKE APPLIED SO THEY WENT BACK TO THE SOUTH END OF THE TRACK AND COUPLED INTO IT. THE CONDUCTOR CUT IN THE AIR AND RELEASED THE HAND BRAKES FROM THE CARS ON THE SOUTH END OF THE TRACK. AT THIS POINT IT SHALL BE NOTED THAT THE TRACK HAS A “CROWN” PROFILE IN THE MIDDLE, SO WHEN THE CREW CUT IN THE AIR AND RELEASED THE BRAKES THE SLACK RAN OUT IN BOTH DIRECTIONS FROM THE PEAK. THE HAND BRAKES ON THE NORTH END OF TRACK DID NOT SECURE THE CARS SUFFICIENTLY ENOUGH TO PREVENT THE SLACK FROM RUNNING OUT CAUSING THE REAR WHEEL TO MOVE OVER THE DERAIL. THE CREW THEN MADE A PULL FORWARD WITH THE REAR CAR DERAILED.

2010A077-d-08-30-10-IAIS.Narrative: CREW RAN THROUGH SWITCH AND ATTEMPTED TO SPIKE THE POINTS FOR THEIR MOVEMENT.  THE SPIKE DID NOT HOLD AND CARS DERAILED ON THE SWITCH.

D502010-d-08-25-10-EIRR.Narrative: CREW HEADED WEST BOUND ON NORTH SIDE SUBDIVISION. AN AUTO EMERGENCY OCCURRED AT MILEPOST 25.02 BRINGING TRAIN TO A STOP. THE CONDUCTOR WALKED TRAIN AND FOUND THAT THREE CARS HAD DERAILED. AFTER FURTHER INVESTIGATION IT WAS FOUND THAT  THAT THE REAR CAR ON TRAIN DERAILED AT MILE POST 25.02 DUE TO BUCKLED RAIL. TRAIN CONTINUED TRAVEL WAST BOUND UNTIL REAR THREE CARS OVER TURNED CAUSING THE AUTO EMERGENCY WHICH STOPPED THE TRAIN.

0810PC005-d-08-11-10-UP.Narrative: LCF33-11 WAS PULLING INTO THE YARD AND DERAILED THE 8TH CAR FROM THE HEAD END ON THE RUNNER/107 SWITCH DUE TO A BROKEN SWITCH POINT.

0810PC007-d-08-24-10-UP.Primary Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
0810PC007-d-08-24-10-UP.Accident Cause: Interaction of lateral/vertical forces (includes harmonic rock off)
0810PC007-d-08-24-10-UP.Narrative: MNPPC-22 WHILE SHOVING THRU BACK TO BACK CROSSOVER SWITCHES, LONG DRAWBAR AND LONG CAR COMBINATION LIFTED WHEEL OFF OF THE TRACK CAUSING 3 CAR DERAILMENT.

0810PC008-d-08-31-10-UP.Primary Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing spikes or other rail fasteners)
0810PC008-d-08-31-10-UP.Accident Cause: Wide gage (due to defective or missing spikes or other rail fasteners)
0810PC008-d-08-31-10-UP.Narrative: INDUSTRY CREW AT JR SIMPLOT WAS SWITCHING ON THEIR LEAD NEXT TO MAIN TRACK 2.  THEY DERAILED INSIDETHEIR FACILITY DUE TO WIDE GAUGE PULLING WESTWARD OVER HAND THROW CROSSOVER FROM THEIR LEAD TO MAIN2 DRAGGING 3 CARS TOWARD MAIN 2 AND FOULING MAIN 2 CAUSING DAMAGE TO UP HAND THROWN CROSSOVERS.

0810PC006-d-08-21-10-UP.Primary Accident Cause: Extreme environmental condition - EXTREME WIND VELOCITY
0810PC006-d-08-21-10-UP.Accident Cause: Extreme environmental condition - EXTREME WIND VELOCITY
0810PC006-d-08-21-10-UP.Narrative: MNPHK-20 TRAVELING WESTBOUND AT A RECORDED SPEED OF 30 MPH DERAILED 9 CARS AT APPROXIMATELY MP 441.75.  EIGHT CARS WERE DERAILED ON THEIR SIDE WITH 1 CAR DERAILED IN AN UPRIGHT POSITION WITH ONE SET OF TRUCKS ON THE GROUND.  CAUSE WAS DETERMINED  TO HAVE BEEN A SEVERE MICRO BURST OF WIND DUE TO THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY IN THIS AREA.  SEVERAL PHONE POLES WERE FOUND TO HAVE BEEN KNOCKED DOWN AS WELL BUILDING DAMAGE IN THE GENERAL AREA.  WINDS WERE RECORDED IN EXCESS OF 70 MPH.  THERE WAS MINIMAL TRACK DAMAGE.  RAIL = CWR
